subject: Julie Chen: A Heart-Wrenching Story
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



       May 16, 
      2007


Hello, 
      everyone

As we 
      enter day 13 in the search for four-year-old Madeleine McCann, our 
      hearts continue to go out to 
      her family.  We learned this 
      morning from her aunt that Madeline 
      has a distinctive right eye -- her pupil and iris 
      connect -- and that may help 
      authorities find and identify her quickly and return her safely to her 
      parents. This horrible story is a grim reminder to all parents that 
      it's never okay to leave a child unattended, no matter how "safe" the 
      circumstances.
As we get ready to deal with the summer 
      heat, today's "Chic on a Shoestring" segment had some great 
      ideas for looks that 
      are light, but also appropriate for the workplace. It's expected to be in the 80s today in 
      New York, so these ideas come just in 
      time! (Did I mention that Dave 
      guessed three out of three? Impressive!) 

Our 
      new series, "Just Ask a Woman," highlighted a growing situation in many 
      offices around the country where 
      women have to learn to 
      deal with younger women being their boss!  Our 
      new Early Show contributor, 
      Mary Lou Quinlan, 
      had some great advice on how people should handle this growing 
      trend.  I can't wait for her segment tomorrow, when she tells us how to handle being 
      told we look great ... for our 
      age!  It's usually meant as a compliment but it can often feel insulting. But, I always say, if someone's intent is good, that should override any bad 
      feelings.
On 
      tomorrow's show, we'll continue Hattie Kaufman's interview with "The 
      Price Is Right" host Bob Barker, who is retiring; Antonio Banderas 
      will be here to tell us about his role in "Shrek the Third," and chef 
      Bobby Flay will be creating some summer fun for us on the Plaza. 
      
Today 
      is an exciting day for us at CBS, as the network officially announces it's 
      fall lineup of shows.  There are some exciting new shows that are 
      unlike any type of programs this network has ever aired.  Stay tuned 
      and watch for yourself this September!
Take care,



Julie 
      Chen
EarlyShow@cbs.com
